publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5270 Jackie Baillie: Meter Relief—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by Scottish Gas to end the practice of back charging token prepayment meter customers; notes that only three of the six main suppliers, Scottish Power, npower and Powergen, continue a practice which forces low income consumers into debt as a result of these suppliers’ failure to reset meters after a price rise, and calls on these companies to follow Scottish Gas by announcing an immediate end to back charging. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*

S2M-5270 Jackie Baillie: Meter Relief—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by Scottish Gas to end the practice of back charging token prepayment meter customers; notes that only three of the six main suppliers, Scottish Power, npower and Powergen, continue a practice which forces low income consumers into debt as a result of these suppliers’ failure to reset meters after a price rise, and calls on these companies to follow Scottish Gas by announcing an immediate end to back charging. Supported by: Donald Gorrie

S2M-5270 Meter Relief (lodged on 5 December 2006) Phil Gallie*, Helen Eadie*, Murray Tosh*, Cathie Craigie*, Mr David Davidson*, John Swinburne*, Trish Godman*, Alex Neil*, Rob Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Margaret Jamieson*, Brian Adam*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Marlyn Glen*, Bill Butler*, Michael McMahon*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Patrick Harvie*, Campbell Martin*, Sarah Boyack*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-5270 Meter Relief (lodged on 5 December 2006) Fiona Hyslop*, Shiona Baird*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Karen Gillon*, Rosie Kane*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Christine May*
S2M-5270 Meter Relief (lodged on 5 December 2006) Dennis Canavan*, Nora Radcliffe*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Karen Whitefield*
S2M-5270 Meter Relief (lodged on 5 December 2006) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Michael Matheson*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-5270 Meter Relief (lodged on 5 December 2006) Mr Duncan McNeil*, Eleanor Scott* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-5270 Meter Relief (lodged on 5 December 2006) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-5270 Meter Relief (lodged on 5 December 2006) Colin Fox*, Elaine Smith*
S2M-5270 Meter Relief (lodged on 5 December 2006) Frances Curran*
S2M-5270 Meter Relief (lodged on 5 December 2006) Chris Ballance*

S2M-5270 Jackie Baillie: Meter Relief—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by Scottish Gas to end the practice of back charging token prepayment meter customers; notes that only three of the six main suppliers, Scottish Power, npower and Powergen, continue a practice which forces low income consumers into debt as a result of these suppliers’ failure to reset meters after a price rise, and calls on these companies to follow Scottish Gas by announcing an immediate end to back charging. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Phil Gallie, Helen Eadie, Murray Tosh, Cathie Craigie, Mr David Davidson, John Swinburne, Trish Godman, Alex Neil, Rob Gibson, Robin Harper, Mr Frank McAveety, Margaret Jamieson, Brian Adam, Dr Elaine Murray, Marlyn Glen, Bill Butler, Michael McMahon, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Patrick Harvie, Campbell Martin, Sarah Boyack, Mr Jim Wallace, Christine Grahame, Fiona Hyslop, Shiona Baird, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Adam Ingram, Karen Gillon, Rosie Kane, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Christine May, Dennis Canavan, Nora Radcliffe, Richard Lochhead, Mr Brian Monteith, Karen Whitefield, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Marilyn Livingstone, Michael Matheson, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Duncan McNeil, Eleanor Scott, Linda Fabiani, Colin Fox, Elaine Smith, Frances Curran, Chris Ballance
